datan

Class LsqAsn

  • java.lang.Object
    • datan.LsqAsn

  • public final class LsqAsn
extends java.lang.Object
    A class determining the asymmetric errors for a set of parameters determined by the least square method using class LsqNon.
    Author:
    Siegmund Brandt.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

    • Constructor Detail

      • LsqAsn

        public LsqAsn(DatanVector t,
      DatanVector y,
      DatanVector deltay,
      DatanVector x0,
      int[] list,
      DatanMatrix cx,
      double m,
      DatanUserFunction luf)
        Parameters:
        t - vector, the elements of which are the controlled variables t_i
        y - vector of the corresponding measured values.
        deltay - vector of measurement errors.
        x0 - position of minimum.
        cx - covariance matrix at x0.
        m - value of minimum function.
        list - array containing the elements of a list specifying which of the n variables are fixed (list element = 0) and which are adjustable (list element = 1).
        luf - user function which must be an extension of the abstract class DatanUserFunction.

      • LsqAsn

        public LsqAsn(DatanVector t,
      DatanVector y,
      DatanVector deltay,
      DatanVector x0,
      DatanMatrix cx,
      double m,
      double w,
      DatanUserFunction luf)
        Parameters:
        t - vector, the elements of which are the controlled variables t_i
        y - vector of the corresponding measured values.
        deltay - vector of measurement errors.
        x0 - position of minimum (all elements of list are set to 1).
        cx - covariance matrix at x0.
        m - value of minimum function.
        w - probalility w for which cinfidence limits are computed. If w <= 0, then assymetry arrors are computed.
        luf - user function which must be an extension of the abstract class DatanUserFunction.

    • Method Detail

      • getAsymmetricErrors

        public double[][] getAsymmetricErrors(double w)
        Parameters:
        w - probalility w for which confidence limits are computed. If w <= 0, then assymetry arrors are computed.
        Returns:
        the asymmetric errors. Element [i][0] is negativer deviation, element [i][1] is positive deviation of the (non-fixed) parameter x[i].

      • hasConverged

        public boolean hasConverged()
        Returns:
        true if iteration successful, false otherwise.
